#Text=Cook Einkorn
#Text=Einkorn is one of the ancient grains that you 've probably seen on grocery shelves .
#Text=These berries are similar to farro or brown rice when cooked and they make a nutritious side .
#Text=For basic boiled einkorn , simmer 1 part of einkorn in 2 parts of water until the berries are tender .
#Text=Try a sweet breakfast porridge that 's topped with fruit , nuts , and cream .
#Text=You can also make a savory risotto that uses einkorn instead of traditional rice .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=Basic Boiled Einkorn
#Text=1 cup ( 200 g ) einkorn berries
#Text=water
#Text=Makes 4 servings
#Text=Einkorn Breakfast Porridge
#Text=1/2 cup ( 100 g ) einkorn berries
#Text=2 teaspoons ( 9 g ) butter
#Text=whole milk
#Text=water , divided
#Text=Sliced fruit to serve
#Text=Sliced or chopped nuts to serve
#Text=heavy cream to serve
#Text=Makes 2 servings
#Text=Savory Einkorn Risotto
#Text=1/2 ( 100 g ) cup einkorn berries
#Text=1 garlic clove , minced
#Text=vegetable broth
#Text=water
#Text=1/2 cup ( 50 g ) grated parmesan
#Text=Makes 2 servings
#Text=Steps
#Text=Boiling Einkorn
#Text=Put the einkorn and water into a pot .
#Text=Measure 1 cup ( 200 g ) of einkorn berries and of water into a pot on the stove .
#Text=Bring the einkorn and water to a boil .
#Text=Turn the burner to high and leave the lid off of the pot so the water comes to a boil .
#Text=Cover and simmer the einkorn for 30 to 35 minutes .
#Text=Turn the burner down to medium or medium-low so the water bubbles gently .
#Text=Put a lid on the pot and simmer the einkorn until most of the water is absorbed .
#Text=The einkorn will swell as it cooks .
#Text=Taste the einkorn to ensure it 's soft to your liking .
#Text=Serve the basic cooked einkorn .
#Text=Turn off the burner and serve the einkorn while it 's hot or let it cool and serve the einkorn once it 's warm .
#Text=You can season it simply with butter , herbs , or spices .
#Text=Try using einkorn in place of rice in your favorite recipes .
#Text=Refrigerate leftover einkorn in an airtight container for up to 3 to 5 days .
#Text=Making Breakfast Einkorn Porridge
#Text=Pulse the einkorn until it 's coarsely cracked .
#Text=Put 1/2 cup ( 100 g ) of einkorn berries into a food processor .
#Text=Put the lid on and pulse the berries 3 to 4 times until they 're cracked .
#Text=If you do n't have a food processor , you can crack the berries in a high-speed blender .
#Text=Melt the butter in a pot and stir in the einkorn .
#Text=Place 2 teaspoons ( 9 g ) of butter into a pot on the stove .
#Text=Turn the burner to medium and melt the butter .
#Text=Stir in the cracked einkorn and stir until it 's coated in the butter .
#Text=Let the einkorn cook for about 1 minute so it toasts a little and smells nutty .
#Text=Add the milk and water and bring it to a boil .
#Text=Pour of whole milk and of the water into the pot with the einkorn .
#Text=Turn the heat to medium-high so the liquid comes to a boil .
#Text=If you prefer , use low-fat , soy , nut , or hemp milk .
#Text=Cover and simmer the einkorn for 30 to 35 minutes .
#Text=Turn the burner down to medium-low and put the lid on the pot .
#Text=Let the einkorn bubble gently until it absorbs the liquid and becomes soft .
#Text=If the einkorn has absorbed the liquid but is n't soft enough , pour in the reserved of water and cook it for another 5 to 10 minutes .
#Text=Serve the breakfast porridge with fruit , nuts , and cream if desired .
#Text=Turn off the burner and transfer the cooked einkorn to serving bowls .
#Text=Sprinkle sliced or chopped nuts over the einkorn and serve it along with your favorite fruit .
#Text=You can also drizzle a few spoonfuls of heavy cream over the porridge .
#Text=To add a little protein and crunch , top the einkorn with almonds , pecans , walnuts , or hazelnuts .
#Text=For a little sweetness , add sliced raisins , pears , peaches , or diced apples to the einkorn .
#Text=Cooking Savory Einkorn Risotto
#Text=Pulse the einkorn until it 's cracked and dusty .
#Text=Put 1/2 ( 100 g ) of cup einkorn berries into a food processor and put the lid on .
#Text=Pulse the einkorn 4 to 5 times so the berries crack and make a little flour .
#Text=Mince the garlic and put it in a pot with water and broth .
#Text=Mince 1 clove of garlic
#Text=and scoop it into a large pot on the stove .
#Text=Pour of vegetable broth and of water into the pot .
#Text=Simmer the liquid .
#Text=Turn the burner to high so the liquid comes to a boil .
#Text=Then turn the burner down to medium so the liquid bubbles gently .
#Text=Keep simmering the liquid the entire time you 're cooking the einkorn .
#Text=Put the cracked einkorn in a skillet .
#Text=Put the skillet on the burner and turn it to medium-low .
#Text=Once it 's warm , stir in the cracked einkorn and let it toast for 1 to 2 minutes .
#Text=The berries should smell a little nutty once they 've toasted long enough .
#Text=Stir of the liquid into the einkorn .
#Text=Use a ladle to scoop about of the liquid out of the pot and slowly pour it into the skillet with the einkorn .
#Text=Stir well while you add the liquid so the einkorn absorbs it .
#Text=Keep stirring of liquid into the einkorn until it 's tender .
#Text=Once the einkorn has absorbed the cupful of liquid , slowly stir in at a time .
#Text=The einkorn should be cooked and soft by the time you 've finished adding the liquid .
#Text=It should take you 40 to 45 minutes to stir in all of the liquid .
#Text=Avoid rushing this or the risotto wo n't cook properly .
#Text=Stir in the parmesan and serve the einkorn risotto .
#Text=Turn off the burner and stir in ½ cup ( 50 g ) of grated parmesan .
#Text=Spoon the risotto onto serving plates or bowls and serve it along with your meal .
#Text=If the risotto is too thick for your liking , you can add another splash of water or vegetable broth .
#Text=Store the leftover risotto in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 to 3 days .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Basic Boiled Einkorn
#Text=Measuring cups
#Text=Large pot with lid
#Text=Spoon
#Text=Einkorn Breakfast Porridge
#Text=Food processor or high-speed blender
#Text=Measuring cups and spoons
#Text=Pot with lid
#Text=Spoon
#Text=Serving bowls
#Text=Savory Einkorn Risotto
#Text=Measuring cups and spoons
#Text=Pot
#Text=Skillet
#Text=Ladle
#Text=Spoon
#Text=Food processor
#Text=Serving plates or bowls
